citations.narrative:
The facility conducts private tours for the public and allows public interaction with a group of Asian small-clawed otters. In
a video dated February 28, 2024, three adult otters are shown biting a customer’s coat and pants and hanging from the
clothing. The attendant has neither direct control of the animals by the use of restraints nor sufficient distance and/or
barriers between the animals and the public. Any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal
and the public.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of the
animals and the public.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Eduardo Vivas, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Repeat
   
Handling of animals. 
The facility conducts private tours for the public and allows public interaction with a group of Asian small-clawed otters. In 
a video dated February 28, 2024, three adult otters are shown biting a customer’s coat and pants and hanging from the 
clothing. The attendant has neither direct control of the animals by the use of restraints nor sufficient distance and/or 
barriers between the animals and the public. Any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal 
and the public. 
 
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with 
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animals and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of the 
animals and the public. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Eduardo Vivas, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
